TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit ServiceModelSecurityTokenRequirement extends System.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenRequirement
Public MustInherit Class ServiceModelSecurityTokenRequirement Inherits SecurityTokenRequirement

Docs.summary: An abstract class that when implemented specifies security property requirements of the token being requested or authenticated that are specific to Windows Communication Foundation (WCF). The security token manager constructs security token providers and security token authenticators that are used by the WCF security processor based on the token requirement.

remarks.format:
## Remarks A security token is a cryptographically signed data unit that transfers authentication and authorization information, based on a credential. The derived class is used by a security token manager to specify what is required of a security token, such as the key size, key type, and how the key can be used. When a security token can be identified that matches the specified criteria, a <xref:System.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenProvider> and <xref:System.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenAuthenticator> can be created to provide security tokens for outgoing SOAP messages and to authenticate security tokens for incoming SOAP messages, respectively. For example, the default security token manager for outgoing SOAP messages has the `CreateSecurityTokenProvider` method that takes a <xref:System.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenRequirement> parameter that can be called to obtain a security token provider that matches the security token provider.
This class's base class, <xref:System.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenRequirement>, contains a dictionary, <xref:System.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenRequirement.Properties%2A>, which maps property names to their values. This class has numerous properties whose name ends in the word "Property". These properties return a string, which is the key used to `get` or `set` the corresponding value from the dictionary. For example, <xref:System.ServiceModel.Security.Tokens.ServiceModelSecurityTokenRequirement.AuditLogLocationProperty%2A> is the key for the value of the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Security.Tokens.RecipientServiceModelSecurityTokenRequirement.AuditLogLocation%2A> property.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.ServiceModel.Security.Tokens.ServiceModelSecurityTokenRequirement.SupportSecurityContextCancellationProperty%2A> is set to `false`.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Shared ReadOnly Property AuditLogLocationProperty As String
public: static property System::String ^ AuditLogLocationProperty { System::String ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the token requirement property name whose value is the location of the audit log to use when recording the results of the authentication (service only).
Docs.value: The key for the AuditLogLocation in the token requirement's Properties dictionary.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The value that corresponds to this property name is of type <xref:System.ServiceModel.AuditLogLocation>, which is an enumeration with the following members:
- <xref:System.ServiceModel.AuditLogLocation.Application>: The Application log in the operating system Event Log.
- <xref:System.ServiceModel.AuditLogLocation.Default>: The default location, which is determined by the operating system.
- <xref:System.ServiceModel.AuditLogLocation.Security>: The Security log in the Event Log.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Shared ReadOnly Property ChannelParametersCollectionProperty As String
public: static property System::String ^ ChannelParametersCollectionProperty { System::String ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the token requirement property name whose value is the channel parameters collection (client only).
Docs.value: The key for the in the token requirement's Properties dictionary.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The value that corresponds to this property name is of type <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.ChannelParameterCollection>.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Shared ReadOnly Property DuplexClientLocalAddressProperty As String
public: static property System::String ^ DuplexClientLocalAddressProperty { System::String ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets a value that specifies the name of the index in the collection for the property.
Docs.value: The name of the index in the collection for the property.

remarks.format: ## Remarks In case the channel that produces the token requirement is a duplex channel, this property contains the endpoint address on which the duplex channel is listening for incoming messages.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Shared ReadOnly Property EndpointFilterTableProperty As String
public: static property System::String ^ EndpointFilterTableProperty { System::String ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the key for the token requirement property whose value is the endpoint filter table that contains the filters for messages that a service endpoint accepts. This is a service property.
Docs.value: The key for the endpoint filter table property of the token requirement.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The value that corresponds to this key is of type <xref:System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.IMessageFilterTable%601>,where the generic type is <xref:System.ServiceModel.EndpointAddress>.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Shared ReadOnly Property ExtendedProtectionPolicy As String
public: static property System::String ^ ExtendedProtectionPolicy { System::String ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the protection policy used by the server to validate incoming client connections.
Docs.value: The protection policy used by the server.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Shared ReadOnly Property HttpAuthenticationSchemeProperty As String
public: static property System::String ^ HttpAuthenticationSchemeProperty { System::String ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the key of the token requirement property whose value is the HTTP authentication scheme if this request is for a token provider or token authenticator to be used in HTTP authentication.
Docs.value: The key of the token requirement's HTTP authentication scheme property.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The value that corresponds to this key is of type <xref:System.Net.AuthenticationSchemes>.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property IsInitiator As Boolean
public: property bool IsInitiator { bool get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the endpoint that is creating the security token requirement is an initiator or a recipient.
Docs.value: if the request is made by the initiator of the channel; otherwise, .

public: static property System::String ^ IsInitiatorProperty { System::String ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the key for the token requirement property whose value indicates whether the request is made by the initiator of the channel or the recipient of the channel.
Docs.value: The key for the token requirement property whose value indicates whether the endpoint that creates the requirement is the initiator or recipient.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The value that corresponds to this token requirement key is of type Boolean.

public: static property System::String ^ IsOutOfBandTokenProperty { System::String ^ get(); };

Docs.value: The key for the token requirement property whose value indicates whether this is the request for a token that is configured on the client or service.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The value that corresponds to this key is of type <xref:System.ServiceModel.Security.Tokens.IssuedSecurityTokenParameters>.

Docs.value: The endpoint address for the token issuer. This is used for issued token types.

Docs.summary: If the token requirement is for an issued token, this property contains the binding to use to communicate with the issuer.
Docs.value: The binding used to communicate with the user.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Returns the binding to use to communicate to the issuer of the security token.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Shared ReadOnly Property IssuerBindingContextProperty As String
public: static property System::String ^ IssuerBindingContextProperty { System::String ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the key for the token requirement property whose value is the to use to talk to the issuing party if the requirement is for an issued token.
Docs.value: The key for the token requirement property whose value is to use to talk to the issuing party.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The value that corresponds to this key is of type <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.BindingContext>. This property is added to the token requirements relating to secure conversation and SPNEGO/TLSNEGO authentication.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Shared ReadOnly Property IssuerBindingProperty As String
public: static property System::String ^ IssuerBindingProperty { System::String ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the key for the token requirement property whose value is the binding to use to talk to the issuing party when the requirement is for an issued token.
Docs.value: The key for the token requirement property whose value is the binding to use to talk to the issuing party.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The value corresponding to this key is of type <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.Binding>.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Shared ReadOnly Property ListenUriProperty As String
public: static property System::String ^ ListenUriProperty { System::String ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the key for the token requirement property whose value is the URI that the service endpoint making the request is listening at (service only).
Docs.value: The key for the token requirement property whose value is the URI that the service endpoint making the request is listening at.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Shared ReadOnly Property MessageAuthenticationAuditLevelProperty As String
public: static property System::String ^ MessageAuthenticationAuditLevelProperty { System::String ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the key for the token requirement property whose value is the audit level to use when recording the results of the authentication (service only).
Docs.value: Gets the key for the token requirement property whose value is the audit level to use when recording the results of the authentication.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The value that corresponds to this key is of type <xref:System.ServiceModel.AuditLevel>, which is an enumeration with the following members:
- <xref:System.ServiceModel.AuditLevel.Failure>: Only failed security-related events are recorded.
- <xref:System.ServiceModel.AuditLevel.None>: No events are recorded.
- <xref:System.ServiceModel.AuditLevel.Success>: Only successful security-related events are recorded.
- <xref:System.ServiceModel.AuditLevel.SuccessOrFailure>: Both failed and successful security-related events are recorded.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Shared ReadOnly Property MessageDirectionProperty As String
public: static property System::String ^ MessageDirectionProperty { System::String ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the key for the token requirement property whose value is the member of the enumeration to use and that indicates whether the token provider is needed for messages sent from client to server or server to client.
Docs.value: Gets the key for the token requirement property whose value is the member of the enumeration to use.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The value that corresponds to this key is of type <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.MessageDirection>. This property can be used by credential implementations to provide different tokens for processing the request and the response. An example is a credential implementation where the endpoint can specify a different certificate that it signs outgoing messages with and a different certificate to be used by other parties to encrypt messages for it.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::IdentityModel::Selectors::SecurityTokenVersion ^ MessageSecurityVersion { System::IdentityModel::Selectors::SecurityTokenVersion ^ get(); void set(System::IdentityModel::Selectors::SecurityTokenVersion ^ value); };

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the message security version to be used (if necessary).
Docs.value: The message security version.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.ServiceModel.MessageSecurityVersion> contains numerous properties that specify version numbers of different components of a message.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Shared ReadOnly Property MessageSecurityVersionProperty As String
public: static property System::String ^ MessageSecurityVersionProperty { System::String ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the key for the token requirement property whose value is the that the channel is configured with.
Docs.value: The key for the token requirement property whose value is the that the channel is configured with.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.ServiceModel.MessageSecurityVersion> contains numerous properties that specify version numbers of different components of a message. The <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.MessageVersion> can be used by token provider and token authenticator implementations to obtain a token from the endpoint (for example, for secure conversation).

Docs.summary: Specifies the current namespace.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Shared ReadOnly Property PrivacyNoticeUriProperty As String

Docs.summary: Gets the key for the token requirement property whose value is the link to the URI that points to the service's privacy policy if the service has one.
Docs.value: The key for the token requirement property whose value is a link to the URI that points to the service's privacy policy.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The value that corresponds to this key is of type <xref:System.Uri>. This property can be used to display the link in the user interface (UI) similar to the way [!INCLUDE[infocard](~/includes/infocard-md.md)] does.

public: static property System::String ^ PrivacyNoticeVersionProperty { System::String ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the key for the token requirement property whose value is a string that represents the privacy notice version.
Docs.value: The key for the token requirement property whose value represents the privacy notice version.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The value that corresponds to this key is of type <xref:System.Int32>. This property can be used to display the link in the user interface (UI) similar to the way [!INCLUDE[infocard](~/includes/infocard-md.md)] does.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::ServiceModel::Security::SecurityAlgorithmSuite ^ SecurityAlgorithmSuite { System::ServiceModel::Security::SecurityAlgorithmSuite ^ get(); void set(System::ServiceModel::Security::SecurityAlgorithmSuite ^ value); };

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the security algorithm suite to be used (if necessary).
Docs.value: The security algorithm suite to be used.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.ServiceModel.Security.SecurityAlgorithmSuite> object that is returned contains numerous properties that specify security algorithms to use in specific conditions. It also describes various security capabilities of the service.

Docs.summary: Gets the key for the token requirement property whose value is the algorithm suite that the channel uses to perform message security.
Docs.value: The key for the token requirement property whose value is .

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::ServiceModel::Channels::SecurityBindingElement ^ SecurityBindingElement { System::ServiceModel::Channels::SecurityBindingElement ^ get(); void set(System::ServiceModel::Channels::SecurityBindingElement ^ value); };

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the security binding element.
Docs.value: The security binding element.

remarks.format: ## Remarks In case of SOAP message security, this property contains the security binding element of the binding that produces the token requirement.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Shared ReadOnly Property SecurityBindingElementProperty As String
public: static property System::String ^ SecurityBindingElementProperty { System::String ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the key for the token requirement property whose value is the security binding element used to create the channel.
Docs.value: The key for the token requirement property whose value is the used to create the channel.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Shared ReadOnly Property SupportingTokenAttachmentModeProperty As String
public: static property System::String ^ SupportingTokenAttachmentModeProperty { System::String ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the key for the token requirement property whose value is the associated enumeration member if the request is for a supporting token.
Docs.value: The key for the token requirement property whose value is the associated enumeration member.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The `SupportingTokenAttachmentMode` property is a member of the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Security.SecurityTokenAttachmentMode> enumeration member if the request is for a supporting token. Supporting tokens provide additional claims beyond those contained in the principal tokens for the binding.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Shared ReadOnly Property SupportSecurityContextCancellationProperty As String
public: static property System::String ^ SupportSecurityContextCancellationProperty { System::String ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the key for the token requirement property whose value indicates whether the secure conversation token is for a security session (in which case its lifetime is tied to the lifetime of the user's channel) or for a datagram security channel.
Docs.value: The key for the token requirement property whose value indicates whether the secure conversation token should be cancelable.

remarks.format: ## Remarks When the requirement is for a secure conversation token, `SupportSecurityContextCancellation` contains a value that indicates whether the secure conversation token is for a security session (in which case its lifetime is tied to the lifetime of the user's channel) or for a datagram security channel.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Shared ReadOnly Property SuppressAuditFailureProperty As String
public: static property System::String ^ SuppressAuditFailureProperty { System::String ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the key for the token requirement property whose value indicates whether to ignore errors that occur when recording the results of the authentication (service only).
Docs.value: The key for the token requirement property whose value indicates whether to ignore errors that occur when recording the results of the authentication.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Shared ReadOnly Property TargetAddressProperty As String
public: static property System::String ^ TargetAddressProperty { System::String ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the key for the token requirement property whose value is the endpoint address that the channel is talking to (client only).
Docs.value: The key for the token requirement property whose value is the that the channel is talking to.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the transport scheme.
Docs.value: The transport scheme.

remarks.format: ## Remarks In case of transport security, this property contains the transport scheme of the `TransportBindingElement` that produces the token requirement.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Shared ReadOnly Property TransportSchemeProperty As String
public: static property System::String ^ TransportSchemeProperty { System::String ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: If the request is made for a token provider/authenticator to be used with transport security, this string is the key for the token requirement property whose value is the transport scheme.
Docs.value: The key for the token requirement property whose value is the transport scheme.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Shared ReadOnly Property ViaProperty As String
public: static property System::String ^ ViaProperty { System::String ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the key for the token requirement property whose value is the Via URI that the channel is connecting to (client only).
Docs.value: The key for the token requirement property whose value is the Via URI that the channel is connecting to.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.ServiceModel.Security.Tokens.InitiatorServiceModelSecurityTokenRequirement.Via%2A> property contains the URI of an intermediate destination.
